++ const Member Function


+++ SUMMARY

member function
  * can not modify the object that called it 
  * cannot change any non-static member variables of the class, 
    * unless member(s) marked mutable.
  * can be called on const instances of the class, 
  * compiler enforces the constness 


+++ Example 1 :
class Example {
    int value;

public:
    Example(int v) : value(v) {}

    // Const member function
    int getValue() const {
        return value;  // This function promises not to modify any member variables
    }
};
